title: Internal Sales Representative  Job at Mantrac
content:
Mantrac is the sole distributor for Caterpillar products in Nigeria, distributing and supporting machinery, power systems and material-handling equipment. The company provides customers with comprehensive solutions, backed by technical know-how, experience and in-depth knowledge of their local markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Sales Representative - Multibrand

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and rebuild relationship (Customer Relationship Management - CRM) with designated and targeted customers by phone to sell parts and service offerings and create sales opportunities to meet company objectives and customer satisfaction.


Main Duties and Responsibilities


	Contact customers to present multi-brand parts and services and answer all technical and commercial inquiries
	Inform customers by phone about new product offerings
	Participate in quotations preparation, terms of payment for his/her supervisor or manager’s review and approval
	Present relevant technical publications as appropriate to customers and explain benefits / advantages of the multi-brand products, with comparison to OEM and OE products
	Follow up on opportunities and quotes to maximize sales and results
	Keep good control of customer list and keep updating customer profiles and population in Salesforce or any existing dealer marketing information system
	Report any prime product sales leads to his / her supervisor, manager or the prime product manager
	Assist with the solution and resolution of customer complaints raised
	Report all lost sales of parts and service to supervisor / manager and to ensure such lost sales are appropriately entered into dealer system (Salesforce)
	Ensure there are no overdue debt on customers’ parts and service account.
	Perform any other related duties as required by product support sales management


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc. Engineering or equivalent. 
	At least 2 years of experience in similar industry (sales, marketing & technical experience)
	Computer literate (MS word, Excel).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: recruitment@mantracnigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.

title: Online Marketing Strategist Job at Amani Advisory Limited
content:
Amani Advisory Limited - Our client is a fast-growing Nigerian marketing agency serving brands across Africa.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Online Marketing Strategist
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Job Summary 
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	 We're looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Manager who can own the digital marketing strategy end-to-end—from campaign ideation to execution and performance analysis. You will work across a diverse portfolio of clients in industries ranging from FMCG, fintech, fashion, hospitality, and tech startups.
	This is a role for someone who is both data-driven and creative, understands the Nigerian consumer landscape, and is hands-on with performance marketing tools and content-led growth strategies.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies tailored to each client’s business goals.
	Translate brand objectives into actionable digital plans across paid, earned, and owned media.
	Research market trends and audience insights within the Nigerian and African digital ecosystem.
	Manage multi-platform campaigns across Google Ads, Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Twitter/X, TikTok, LinkedIn, and YouTube.
	Oversee SEO/SEM efforts including keyword research, backlinking, and on-page optimization.
	Implement email marketing flows (Mailchimp, Klaviyo, etc.) for nurture and acquisition.
	Collaborate with the creative team to ideate, brief, and approve high-performing ad creatives and content formats (video, static, carousels, UGC).
	Serve as a strategic liaison between internal teams and clients, ensuring alignment and transparency.
	Supervise a team of digital executives, performance marketers, and content strategists.
	Guide influencer marketing strategies and partnerships, especially for Nigerian Gen Z and Millennial audiences.
	Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance using GA4, Meta Business Suite, Google Data Studio, and other analytics tools.
	Create and present monthly performance reports, highlighting insights, ROI, and growth opportunities.
	Ensure delivery of projects within budget and on time.


Person Specification


	4–6 years of experience in digital marketing (agency experience preferred).
	Strong knowledge of the Nigerian digital marketing space—local platforms, culture, and user behavior.
	Proven experience managing paid media campaigns with measurable ROI.
	Proficiency in Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, GA4, SEO tools (SEMRush, Ahrefs), and CRM/email marketing platforms.
	Strong copywriting, editing, and campaign storytelling skills.
	Excellent Excel, reporting, and dashboarding abilities.
	Strong organizational, project management, and multitasking skills.
	Experience with eCommerce, tech startups, or FMCG brands in Nigeria.
	Certification in Google Ads, Meta Blueprint, or HubSpot is a plus.
	Basic understanding of web development, UI/UX, or HTML/CSS.


What We Offer


	Salary: N300,000 per month. 
	Competitive salary + performance bonus.
	Fast-paced agency environment with diverse clients and industries.
	Continuous training, certifications, and growth opportunities.
	Flexible working hours and hybrid setup.
	Access to tools and budgets to execute bold campaigns.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: talent@amaniadvisory.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: IT Technical Support & Compliance Officer Job at Enviable Group
content:
Enviable Group is a fast-growing, diversified conglomerate with operations across finance, retail, agriculture, and real estate. Our success relies on a secure, reliable, and policy-driven technology backbone. We are expanding our IT team to ensure every branch receives the same high-quality support and governance that fuels our growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Technical Support & Compliance Officer
Job Locations: Abuja, Lagos (Ikorodu & Victoria Island), Umuahia - Abia, Enugu and Asaba - Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	You will be the first-line technical contact for staff in your assigned branch while actively monitoring systems and user activities for compliance with Group IT policies.
	This dual focus - hands-on support and governance oversight means you’ll fix everyday IT issues, train colleagues, and help embed security-minded habits throughout the organisation.


Key Responsibilities/KPI
Typical Activities;End-User Support (50%):


	Diagnose & resolve hardware, software, network, and printer issues (Windows, macOS & mobile)
	Manage user accounts, Gmail, and Google Workspace services
	Escalate complex incidents to Head Office while maintaining ownership until closure


Compliance & Monitoring (30%):


	Perform daily/weekly checks against Group IT Policy (asset logs, patch status, AV dashboards, backup reports)
	Run spot audits and document findings with corrective actions
	Ensure new devices & apps meet security baseline before deployment


Training & Documentation (15%):


	Deliver short classroom or one-on-one sessions on safe computing, phishing awareness, and productivity tips using Google Workspace tools
	Keep branch “How-To” guides and knowledge-base articles current


Project & Vendor Support (5%):


	Assist with roll-outs (WAN upgrades, CCTV, VoIP, ERP modules)
	Liaise with external vendors, verify work quality, and sign-off against SLAs


Key Qualifications


	OND / HND / Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or recognised equivalent).
	Minimum 3 years of hands-on technical support in a multi-site or enterprise environment.
	Demonstrated track record of enforcing or adhering to information-security or IT-governance standards (ISO 27001, ITIL, or similar)
	Windows & macOS administration; basic Linux familiarity.
	Networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, Wi-Fi).
	Google Workspace administration (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Meet) including groups, shared drives, and access controls.
	Endpoint security tools and patch-management platforms.
	Soft Skills: Excellent written & spoken English; calm customer-service manner; strong documentation habits; ability to joggle priorities independently.
	Willingness to travel between assigned branches - typically one short trip per month - and occasionally assist neighbouring sites (company-funded).
	Industry certifications (Google Workspace Administrator, or equivalent) is a PLUS
	Experience with help-desk ticketing systems (Jira, Freshservice, or similar) is an added advantage
	Basic scripting (PowerShell / Bash) for automation.
	Familiarity with CCTV, VoIP, or point-of-sale hardware.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary + performance bonus + HMO + Pension
	Friendly, growth-oriented culture with clear internal promotion paths.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a concise cover letter (max 1 page) to: careers@enviable.group using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Short-listed candidates will complete a practical troubleshooting test and policy-scenario interview.
	Enviable Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, gender, or disability status.

title: Business Development Manager Job at Dev-Afrique Development Advisors
content:
Dev-Afrique Development Advisors is a social-impact organization of strategy and development professionals committed to solving complex challenges on the African continent. With networks across African countries, we provide high-level advisory and develop unique strategies for non-profit organizations and start-ups in emerging and frontier markets in Africa. Our expertise extends across agriculture, environment and climate change, financial inclusion, health, water sanitation and hygiene and public policy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Abuja

About the Position
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a Business Development Manager with a strong grasp of the development landscape to lead and support our firm’s growth efforts.
	The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience in identifying opportunities (RFQs, RFPs, EOIs), crafting compelling responses, and driving proposal development.
	You will collaborate across internal teams and external partners to position the organization for strategic wins and long-term success.


Responsibilities
Key responsibilities for this position include:
Opportunity Scouting & Pipeline Development:


	Proactively search and track Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Requests for Quotations (RFQs), Expressions of Interest (EOIs), and other new business opportunities from bilateral/multilateral agencies and foundations.
	Build and manage a robust pipeline of relevant opportunities aligned with the firm’s thematic and geographic priorities.
	Maintain and update a database of procurement platforms and tender trackers (e.g., Devex, UNGM, DG Market, etc.).


Proposal & Bid Development:


	Lead end-to-end proposal development processes, including bid/no-bid decisions, timeline management, partner coordination, and submission.
	Draft and/or refine technical proposals, capability statements, cover letters, and past performance documentation in response to client requirements.
	Work with technical leads and project teams to develop winning methodologies, staffing plans, and technical narratives.
	Prepare budget inputs in collaboration with the finance team, ensuring competitive pricing aligned with client expectations.


Strategic Partnerships & Relationship Management:


	Identify and nurture partnerships with local and international organizations for consortium-based bidding.
	Represent the firm in external networking events, partnership meetings, and strategic dialogues with potential clients and collaborators.
	Maintain CRM records of donors, partners, and opportunity pipelines.


Market Intelligence & Positioning:


	Conduct sector scans and client mapping to identify emerging trends and align business development strategies accordingly.
	Develop marketing collateral and thought leadership content to support outreach efforts.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in international development, Business, Public Policy, Economics, or a related field; a master’s degree is preferred.
	Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in business development or program acquisition, preferably in a consulting, donor-funded, or professional services environment.
	Demonstrated track record in identifying and responding to donor-funded RFPs/RFQs/EOIs.
	Exceptional proposal writing, project management, and communication skills.
	Strong knowledge of the development donor landscape (e.g., USAID, World Bank, UN agencies, BMGF, GIZ).
	Ability to work collaboratively in multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and BD tools.


Useful Skills:


	Familiarity with strategic consulting or advisory firms’ business models.
	Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to manage ambiguity in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment.

title: Account Officer Job at Gas Tech International Limited
content:
Gas Tech International Limited is an emerging Compressed and Natural Gas organisation situated along the Sagamu-Ore expressway in Ilisan, Ikenne local government area, Ogun State. We are looking to enhance our team with additional talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Ilisan, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Account Officer is responsible for managing and monitoring all financial transactions related to gas sales at the NGV dispensing station.
	The role ensures the accurate recording of daily sales, proper handling, and reporting of cash inflows, reconciliation of customer payments, and timely preparation of daily and periodic financial reports.
	This position serves as a financial control point to ensure transparency, compliance, and operational efficiency.


Tasks and Activities of the Role


	Verify and reconcile daily cash and POS Payments from gas sales to vehicle owners
	Ensure prompt banking of daily cash and provide deposit slips
	Assist in Monthly reconciliations of NGV Point transactions with central accounts
	Maintain confidentiality and accuracy in financial documentation.
	Maintain receipts, sales documents, and related financial records in an orderly and secure manner.
	Support internal and external audits with necessary documents.
	Any other duties as assigned by the Finance Manager.


Required Skills and Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 Years of experience in cashiering or accounting role, preferably in a retail or fuel/gas sales environment.
	Strong understanding of financial reporting and account reconciliation.
	Good communication Skills.
	Attention to detail.
	Willingness to work shifts, weekends, and public holidays as required.


Compensation and Benefits
We offer a competitive compensation package, including:


	A competitive Salary
	Health Maintenance Organisation (HMO) Plan
	Annual Leave allowance
	Statutory Pension Contributions
	Opportunities for training and Growth
	A safe and supportive work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: hrjobs@gastechltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.
